name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong
overview: Mario vs. Donkey Kong returns to the gaming world as a side-scrolling puzzle-platformer exclusively for the Nintendo Switch. This title is a remake of the 2004 Game Boy Advance game that shares its name. Visually, the game has undergone a significant transformation; Moving away from the original's pre-rendered visuals and the subsequent series' plastic, cartoony aesthetics, the remake embraces a modern art direction. This contemporary approach draws inspiration from "Super Mario 3D World" and its representation within "Super Mario Maker 2." Furthermore, the game introduces a fresh logo design for the esteemed Donkey Kong series. Feature List: 3D Models: Unlike its predecessor which utilized pre-rendered sprites, the remake showcases full 3D models. Animated Cutscenes: The storytelling is enhanced with fully animated cutscenes, offering more dynamism than the original's static frames. Redesigned Characters: Updated designs for characters like Tane Pakkun, which have transformed into mechanical Fire Piranha Plants. Toy Ninjis now bear a resemblance to the current design of regular Ninjis, and Brickmen feature movable bricks over their eyes for added expression. Multiplayer Mode: For the first time, players can venture with a friend with the addition of Toad as a second playable character. Language Options: The game has broadened its accessibility with translations in Chinese (Simplified and Traditional), Dutch, and Korean – languages that were absent in the original. It also includes Canadian French and Latin American Spanish translations.
